recipes.name: Adobo
recipes.description: A popular Filipino dish consisting of meat (commonly chicken, pork, or a combination) marinated in vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, bay leaves, and black peppercorns then simmered until tender.

recipes.name: Sinigang
recipes.description: A sour soup or stew characterized by its distinct sour flavor, typically made with pork, beef, or seafood, along with vegetables like kangkong (water spinach), radish, eggplant, and tomatoes.

recipes.name: Kare-Kare
recipes.description: A rich and savory Filipino stew made with oxtail, tripe, and vegetables cooked in a thick peanut sauce, served with bagoong (shrimp paste) on the side.

recipes.name: Lechon
recipes.description: A whole roasted pig dish, popular during celebrations and special occasions, known for its crispy skin and tender meat seasoned with spices and herbs.

recipes.name: Pancit
recipes.description: A stir-fried noodle dish made with rice noodles, meat (such as chicken, pork, or shrimp), and vegetables, seasoned with soy sauce and often garnished with calamansi and chopped green onions.

recipes.name: Bulalo
recipes.description: A hearty beef soup made with bone marrow, beef shanks, and vegetables like corn, cabbage, and bok choy, flavored with fish sauce and peppercorns.

recipes.name: Tinola
recipes.description: A clear chicken soup flavored with ginger, garlic, and fish sauce, with green papaya or sayote (chayote) and chili leaves added for flavor and nutrition.

recipes.name: Paksiw
recipes.description: A cooking method where meat (commonly fish or pork) is simmered in a vinegar-based sauce with garlic, ginger, and spices, resulting in a tangy and savory dish.

recipes.name: Sisig
recipes.description: A flavorful dish made from chopped pig's head and liver, seasoned with calamansi juice, soy sauce, and chili peppers, often served on a sizzling plate.

recipes.name: Tinapang Bangus
recipes.description: Milkfish (bangus) that has been marinated, smoked, and dried, resulting in a flavorful and aromatic fish commonly eaten with rice and vinegar.

recipes.name: Dinuguan
recipes.description: A savory pork blood stew made with pork meat, innards, and/or skin cooked in a rich, thick gravy flavored with vinegar, garlic, and chili peppers.

recipes.name: Pinakbet
recipes.description: A vegetable dish made with mixed vegetables like eggplant, bitter melon, squash, and okra, saut√©ed with shrimp paste and sometimes pork or seafood.

recipes.name: Champorado
recipes.description: A sweet chocolate rice porridge made by boiling glutinous rice with cocoa powder or tablea (local chocolate tablets), often served with evaporated milk and dried fish.

recipes.name: Humba
recipes.description: A sweet and savory pork dish similar to adobo, but with the addition of pineapple juice, resulting in a tender and flavorful stew.

recipes.name: Lumpia
recipes.description: Filipino spring rolls filled with a mixture of minced meat (usually pork or chicken), vegetables, and sometimes shrimp, then fried until crispy.

recipes.name: Laing
recipes.description: A spicy Filipino dish made from dried taro leaves and coconut milk, often cooked with shrimp paste, pork, and chili peppers.

recipes.name: Puto
recipes.description: A type of Filipino steamed rice cake made from rice flour, sugar, and coconut milk, often served as a snack or dessert.

recipes.name: Taho
recipes.description: A sweet and comforting snack made from soft tofu, arnibal (sweet syrup made from brown sugar and vanilla), and sago pearls.

recipes.name: Balut
recipes.description: A fertilized duck egg with a partially developed embryo inside, boiled and typically eaten with a sprinkle of salt or a dip in vinegar.

recipes.name: Longganisa
recipes.description: A sweet and savory Filipino sausage made from ground pork seasoned with garlic, sugar, and spices, often served for breakfast with garlic rice and eggs.

recipes.name: Pancit Malabon
recipes.description: A seafood noodle dish from the city of Malabon, characterized by its thick rice noodles, topped with a shrimp, squid, and smoked fish sauce.

recipes.name: Inihaw na Pusit
recipes.description: Grilled squid marinated in a mixture of vinegar, soy sauce, calamansi juice, and garlic, resulting in a smoky and flavorful seafood dish.

recipes.name: Turon
recipes.description: A Filipino dessert made from ripe bananas rolled in brown sugar, wrapped in spring roll wrappers, and fried until crispy, often served with a drizzle of caramel sauce.

recipes.name: Ginataang Langka
recipes.description: A Filipino dish made from unripe jackfruit cooked in coconut milk, often with shrimp, pork, or fish, seasoned with garlic, ginger, and chili peppers.
